applicant_types: Registered charities; Community organisations; Social enterprises (CICs, with restrictions)
geographic_scope: Tyne & Wear, Northumberland, North East England (occasional calls for Durham, Tees Valley, or elsewhere in UK)
beneficiary_focus: Poverty; Health; Community safety; Vulnerable people; General community benefit
funding_range: £1,000 - £10,000 (average grant £6,000; some larger grants via specific calls)
restrictions: Main area of benefit is Tyne & Wear and Northumberland; Applications from outside North East England (e.g., Kent) only eligible if a current call for applications covers that area; Priority to charities with income up to £1M (esp. <£0.5M), but larger charities considered if best placed to meet need; No funding for activities not charitable in law, general appeals, primarily religious/animal welfare/statutory obligations, retrospective funding, or for-profit companies
application_status: rolling (for North East); calls for other areas as announced
deadline: Unclear (rolling for core area; specific deadlines for calls outside North East)
notes: ellenor Hospice is not in the core area of benefit. Only eligible if a specific call for applications is open for Kent or their area. No evidence of such a call in the provided text.
evidence: 1. The Community Foundation's main area of benefit is Tyne & Wear and Northumberland, with grants awarded to causes in North East England. ('Our main area of benefit is Tyne & Wear (Newcastle, Gateshead, North Tyneside, South Tyneside and Sunderland) and Northumberland. If you are based here, or your organisation’s work benefits all or part of our area, you can apply at any time.') 2. For organisations outside this area (including Kent), applications are only accepted if there is a current call for applications that explicitly includes their area. ('If your work is in Durham, the Tees Valley or elsewhere in the UK, please only apply if we have a current call for applications that says we will award funding in your area. Otherwise your application will not be eligible.') 3. No evidence in the provided text of any current call for applications covering Kent or ellenor Hospice's service area. 4. While registered charities and health-related causes are eligible in principle, the geographic restriction is explicit and exclusionary. 5. Therefore, ellenor Hospice is not eligible unless a specific call for Kent is open, which is not indicated in the supplied information.
